In addition to reading The Problem of Political Authority, it might be a good idea to read Bryan Caplan's posts on the obligation to help the poor:

- http://econlog.econlib.org/archives/2014/03/poverty_the_sta.html
- http://econlog.econlib.org/archives/2014/03/poverty_the_sta_1.html
- http://econlog.econlib.org/archives/2010/05/conscientiousne.html
- http://econlog.econlib.org/archives/2012/01/caplan-smith_gm.html
- http://econlog.econlib.org/archives/2009/03/econlog_book_cl_10.html
- http://econlog.econlib.org/archives/2010/08/how_far_does_th.html

Caplan and Huemer hold similar views on various issues (e.g. both are anarcho-capitalists) and cite each other, but I find Caplan "showcases" his thinking style in a wider array of topics which is helpful for building intuition.

Promoting acceptance runs into some thorny issues surrounding moral advocacy: https://causeprioritization.org/Moral%20advocacy#external-links (disclosure: I compiled the links on that page).

For more on official development assistance, you might see the EA ODA group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/733606323454075/

Somewhat related also are http://blog.givewell.org/2015/11/06/the-lack-of-controversy-over-well-targeted-aid/ and some of the comments at https://www.facebook.com/groups/effective.altruists/permalink/1333798200009867/
